data.title: Summer sounds: Central Illinois concert preview
data.meta_description: From “Weird Al” to the Woodbox Gang, Reba to the Roots and Loretta Lynn to “Lord of the Dance,” here's a look at summer concerts in the immediate central Illinois area. All concert information is sub…
data.text:
From “Weird Al” to the Woodbox Gang, Reba to the Roots and Loretta Lynn to “Lord of the Dance,” here's a look at summer concerts in the immediate central Illinois area. All concert information is subject to change.

Springfield and area

AMEREN SUMMER SERENADES

Washington Street between Fifth and Sixth streets. All concerts are free and begin at 7 p.m. For more information, call 535-5111.

June 12: Cowboy Crush

AMERICAN MUSIC SHOW AT THE TASTE OF DOWNTOWN

Fifth and Washington streets, 544-1723, www.downtownspringfield.org/

July 12: Eva Hunter Band, 3 p.m.; the Hi-Risers, 4 p.m.; Marti Brom with Rocky Velvet, 6 p.m.; Dale Watson, 8 p.m.; and the Deadstring Brothers, 10 p.m.; $2 admission covers all performances

BLACK SHEEP CAFE

1320 S. 11th St., 492-5150, www.myspace.com/blacksheepcafe. All shows start at 7 p.m. unless otherwise noted.

Friday: Rule 22, Green Room Rockers and Don’t Mess with Winkie

Sunday: Liferuiner, Dr. Acula and CH Vs. SB 1999

Tuesday: The Skies Revolt, Horizontal Orange and the Murder City Allstars

May 25: Here I Come Falling, Novella, Dresden and the Murder City Allstars

May 27: Don’t Mess With Winkie, the Revengers, Shut Up Travis and the Wide Awakes

June 1: Forever in Terror, the Dread Corsair, Estrus and Infliction of Need

June 6: The Years Gone By,

June 29: Years Spent Cold

July 8: The Casualties with Time Again,

July 21: Lower Class Brats

July 25-27: Black Sheep Fest ’08

CITY NIGHTS THEATER AT THE CAPITAL CITY BAR & GRILL

149 S. Dirksen Parkway, 529-8580, www.myspace.com/capitalcitybar

May 30: JOBU, 9 p.m.

June 4: The Deep End, 9 p.m.

June 13: Ragged Jack and Heartsfield, 8 p.m.

CLUB CHROME

3075 Normandy Road, 585-9655, www.myspace.com/chromebooking. All shows begin at 8 p.m. unless otherwise noted. Unless otherwise noted, ticket prices are advance, followed by day-of-show.

Friday: Dead at Midnite, Through Terror, Demolition Day and Refuse Life, $5

May 23: Elijah Sound, Black Ops, Hemisaurus and Culo Peligroso, $5

June 7: 217 Fest 2 with New Society of Anarchists, Pound for Pound, the Dread Corsair, Kick to Tha Head, Swallow Your Pride, DinyourA, Code 30, the Revengers, Don’t Mess With Winkie, Infliction of Need, Resolve, A Death and a Promise, the Zombots, Victims of Our Virtues and Corcid, noon, $8 and $10

June 13: Forty Lashes, the Revengers, Epic Mayhem and Total Relapse, $5

June 14: Tub Ring, nil8, the Wide Awakes and the Abcinators, $8

June 18: The Murder Junkies with DinyourA, Bone-Setter and Jason and the Punk Necks, 21-and-older, $6 and $8

HOOGLAND CENTER FOR THE ARTS

420 S. Sixth St., 523-2787, www.scfta.org. Tickets available at the center box office, by calling 523-2787 or online at www.scfta.org

May 25: The YellowJackets with Eric Marienthal, 7 p.m., $28.25

June 7: The Second City Touring Company, 5 and 8 p.m., $25

June 14: Robbie Fulks with Elizabeth Cook, 8 p.m., $20

June 20: Judith Owen, 8 p.m., $16.75

June 28: Venice, 8 p.m., $45 and $37

ILLINOIS BUILDING

Illinois State Fairgrounds; tickets available by calling 467-2882, online at www.wqlz.com or at the following locations: the Party Tree, 3425 Freedom Drive; Dreamtime Tattoo, 136 West Lake Shore Drive; and 995 W. Eldorado St. in Decatur.

June 5: 10 Years with Rev Theory and One Less Reason, 8 p.m., $15 in advance and $18 at the door

ILLINOIS STATE FAIR GRANDSTAND

Tickets available through Ticketmaster by phone at 544-9400, (800) 827-8927 or (800) 359-2525 (TTY), or at www.ticketmaster.com or at physical outlets. Ticket order forms can be downloaded on the state fair Web site, www.illinoisstatefair.info. The Grandstand ticket office will start accepting mail orders postmarked after Monday and will open at 9 a.m. June 7 for walk-up sales. Mail orders should be sent to Illinois State Fair Ticket Office, P.O. Box 19427, Springfield, IL 62794-9427. Unless otherwise noted, top prices are for track and best reserved seating; other prices are for reserved seating. All concerts begin at 8 p.m. unless otherwise noted

Aug. 8: TBA

Aug. 9: “Weird Al” Yankovic, $20 and $10

Aug. 10: Huey Lewis and the News, $30, $25 and $20

Aug. 11: Illinois Symphony Orchestra, free

Aug. 15: Brooks & Dunn and ZZ Top, 7:30 p.m., $38, $34 and $30

Aug. 16: Vanessa Hudgens, $25 and $20

Aug. 17: Trace Adkins with Trent Tomlinson, $25, $20 and $18

MUSIC IN THE PARK SERIES

A series of free concerts presented by the Springfield Parks Foundation. All concerts are free. Performing artists have yet to be announced. The schedule through August is as follows:

July 13: Enos Park, North Eighth and Enterprise streets; jazz, country/western, classic rock and gospel will be presented from 4 to 7 p.m.

July 19: Comer Cox Park: Black, White and Blues Festival, 18th Street and Capitol Avenue; blues and jazz will be presented from 2 to 7 p.m.

Aug. 23: Dreamland Park, 2400 Taylor Avenue; blues and jazz will be presented from 6 to 9 p.m.

OLD CAPITOL BLUES & BBQs

Noon to midnight, Fifth Street between Adams and Jefferson, $5 admission, 891-0792

Aug. 23: Felix and the Cats, 4 p.m.; Tarbox Ramblers, 6:30 p.m.; Calvin Cooke, 8 p.m.; and Howard and the White Boys, 10 p.m.

POWERLIGHT FESTIVAL

Noon to 9 p.m., Lincoln Stage - Illinois State Fairgrounds, www.997kissfm.com. Free admission after paid admission to fairgrounds. More bands to be announced.

Aug. 17: Family Force 5 and P.J. Summers Band

SANGAMON AUDITORIUM

University of Illinois at Springfield; tickets available at the auditorium ticket office, by calling 206-6160 or online at www.sangamonauditorium.org

Today: Arlo Guthrie, 7:30 p.m., $41 and $36

June 28: Loretta Lynn, 8 p.m., $54 and $44

SANGAMON COUNTY FAIR GRANDSTAND

June 18-22, Sangamon County Fairgrounds, New Berlin. Fair admission, which includes Grandstand entry, is $10 for adults Wednesday and Sunday, $15 for adults Thursday-Saturday, $35 for adult season passes, $5 for seniors 60 and older and children 3-10 (with $20 season passes available for both) and free for children 3 and under. Shows begin at 8:30 p.m.

June 18: Mean Street: A Tribute to Van Halen

June 19: Little Big Town

June 20: Blake Shelton with Kellie Pickler

June 21: Randy Owen of Alabama

THEATRE IN THE PARK AT NEW SALEM

Lincoln's New Salem State Historic Site, Petersburg. Tickets are $12 for adults, $10 for seniors and $7 for children under 12. For reservations, visit the box office, call 632-5440 or go to www.theatreinthepark.net. All shows begin at 8 p.m.

June 20-21: Songwriters Circle with Ben Bedford, Paul Ingle and Tom Irwin

July 11-12: Dyed in the Wool

WASHINGTON STREET JAZZ FESTIVAL

6 p.m. to midnight, between Fifth and Sixth streets on Washington Street, downtown Springfield, $10. Rain or shine. Six bands on two stages play jazz and blues.

June 28: The Beatniks, 6 p.m.; the Pauline York Band, 7 p.m.; Bob Katt & the Missing Lynx, 8 p.m.; Delta Highway, 9 p.m.; Glenn Wilson, 10 p.m.; and Pleasure Chest, 11 p.m.

Bloomington-Normal

BLOOMINGTON CENTER FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS

107 E. Chestnut St., Bloomington, (309) 434-2777, www.artsblooming.org

Friday: Arlo Guthrie, 7:30 p.m.; tickets are: $40.50, $38.50 and $34.50 for adults; $38.50, $36.50 and $32.50 for seniors 65 and older; and $32.50, $30.90 and $27.70 for those in high school or younger

Sunday: Michael Flatley’s “Lord of the Dance,” 3 p.m., $44.50 and $34.50

MCLEAN COUNTY FAIRGROUNDS

July 30-Aug. 3, Interstate Center, Bloomington, 2301 W. Market St., (309) 829-3976, www.mcleancountyfair.org. Single-day admission to the grounds, which includes grandstand entry, is $5 for adults, $3 for children 6-12 and free for children 5 and under.

Aug. 1: John Anderson, 7 p.m.

NEW LAFAYETTE CLUB

1602 S. Main St., Bloomington, (309) 828-1212, www.dept-56.org/lafayette/

Friday: James McMurtry with Justin Townes Earle, 8 p.m., $15 and $17; advance tickets available online at www.wwhp.com/WhipShows.htm#

June 15: Jagermeister Music Tour with Hatebreed, 3 Inches of Blood and Oceano, 7 p.m., $20; tickets available online at www.ticketrumba.com or www.ticketweb.com

NOTHIN’ BUT THE BLUES FESTIVAL

Tri-Lakes, 2100 Bunn St., Bloomington, (309) 827-9037, www.nothinbutthebluesfestival.com. Tickets are $15 per day in advance and $18 per day at the door. Children 12 and under are free. For tickets: visit Samuel Music, 3730 Wabash Ave.; call (309) 820-0099; order at www.nothinbutthebluesfestival.com; or mail Nothin’ But the Blues Festival, P.O. Box 265, Normal, IL 61761.The schedule is as follows:

July 18: Cleveland Fats, 6 p.m.; Mike Wheeler Band, 7 p.m.; Teeny Tucker, 8:15 p.m.; and Larry McCray, 9 p.m.

July 19: Steve “The Harp” Blues Band, 1:30 p.m.; TBA, 3 p.m.; Alvin Jett and the Phat Noiz Band, 4:15 p.m.; Janiva Magness, 5:30 p.m.; Holmes Brothers, 6:45 p.m.; and Thornetta Davis, 8:15 p.m.

U.S. CELLULAR COLISEUM

101 S. Madison St., Bloomington, (309) 434-2843, www.uscellularcoliseum.com

June 12: Reba McEntire with Lady Antebellum, 7:30 p.m., $75, $52.50 and $42.50

July 20: Boston with Lou Gramm, 7 p.m., $54.50, $44.50 and $34.50

WGLT-FM 89.1 SUMMER CONCERT

Jefferson and Center streets in downtown Bloomington, www.wglt.org/events. All shows are free.

June 14: Matthew Curry with Bill Porter and Friends, 4:30 p.m.; the Belleville Outfit, 6 p.m.; Smokin’ Joe Kubek and Bnois King, 8 p.m.

Champaign-Urbana

THE CANOPY CLUB

708 S. Goodwin, Urbana, 344-2263, www.jaytv.com/can2/. Those attending must be 18 to enter and 21 to drink. Shows with two ticket prices are advance, followed by day-of-show. Tickets also are available at www.etix.com. Additional show schedules are available on the venue Web site. All shows start at 9 p.m. unless otherwise noted.

May 29: Broken Spindles with Mordecai in the Mirror, $8

June 6: Fein-Bursoni Anti-Rehearsal Dinner Show with Headlights and more, $8

June 7: Echoes of Pink Floyd, $7

June 9: Ugly Radio Rebellion performs Frank Zappa with Ike Willis, $12

July 18-20: Central Illinois Metalfest 2008, schedule TBA, $65 for a three-day pass

THE HIGHDIVE

51 Main St., Champaign, 359-4444, www.thehighdive.com. Tickets are available at the door or online at www.ticketfusion.com. Shows with two ticket prices are advance, followed by day-of-show.

May 22: Woodbox Gang with Corn Desert Ramblers, 9 p.m., $7

May 25: 1993 Revisited with Honcho Overload, Mother / Menthol, the Moon Seven Times, Dick Justice, Corndolly and Driver Has No Cash, 8 p.m., $10

May 29: Bang Camaro with Vanattica and Monster Honkey, 9 p.m., $10 and $12

May 31: Paul Thorn, 8 p.m., $18 and $20

June 27: Carolyn Wonderland, 8 p.m., $15

June 28: Ari Hest, 7:30 p.m., $10 and $12

July 17: Robbie Fulks, 8:30 p.m., $10 and $12

July 27: Laurie Morvan with Kilborn Alley, 7 p.m., $10

THE VIRGINIA THEATRE

203 W. Park, Champaign, 356-9063, www.thevirginia.org

July 25: Jars of Clay, 7 p.m., $32, $25 and $17, tickets go on sale June 6

Chillicothe

SUMMER CAMP 2008

Three Sisters Park. Three-day tickets with camping are $155 in advance and $170 at the gate. Separate tickets for late-night shows and a Thursday-night pre-party are extra, and VIP packages are available.

Tickets are available by calling (800) 514-3849; online at www.etix.com; or through Ticketmaster by phone at 544-9400, (800) 827-8927 and (800) 359-2525 for TTY orders, online at www.ticketmaster.com and at all physical outlets. For more information, including a full list of performers, go to www.summercampfestival.com. A printable schedule is available online at www.jambase.com/festivals/summercamp.

Performers by day are:

+ May 23: moe., The Flaming Lips, Umphrey’s McGee, the Avett Brothers, the Lee Boys, Dub Trio and more.

+ May 24: moe., O.A.R., the Roots, Umphrey’s McGee, Blind Melon, the Reverend Peyton’s Big Damn Band, Lotus and more.

+ May 25: The New Pornographers, moe., George Clinton and Parliament Funkadelic, Umphrey’s McGee, Hot Buttered Rum, Papa Mali, Badfish: A Tribute to Sublime and more.

Decatur

DECATUR CELEBRATION

Aug. 1-3, downtown Decatur, www.decaturcelebration.com. All shows are free. Times and additional performers to be announced.

Aug. 1: Vince Vance and the Valiants

Aug. 2: Bay City Rollers feat. Ian Mitchell; the Smithereens; Anthony Gomes

Aug. 3: Plain White T’s; Edgar Winter Band

MACON COUNTY FAIR

June 10-15, Macon County Fairgrounds, 3700 N. West Lawn Ave., Decatur, 875-0135, www.maconcountyfair.com. Advance tickets available at Hickory Point Bank & Trust, 3131 W. Wabash Ave., in Springfield.

June 13: Confederate Railroad, 8 p.m., $10 in advance, $15 day of show

June 14: Firehouse with BulletBoys and House of Nasty, 7 p.m., $10 in advance, $15 day of show

Peoria

CEFCU CENTER STAGE AT THE LANDING

200 N.E. Water St., Peoria, www.peoriaparks.org/river/riverfront_calendar.html. Unless otherwise noted, tickets are available by calling (800) 594-8499 or online at ejspresents.tickets.musictoday.com. Additional show schedule available on the Web site.

June 27-28: Universal Rhythm Assembly, 4 p.m. both days, with the North Indiana Allstars (feat. Jake Cinninger, Joel Cummins and Kris Myers of Umphrey’s McGee and Stephen Perkins of Jane’s Addiction), EOTO (feat. Jason Hann and Michael Travis of the String Cheese Incident), New Monsoon, Cornmeal, Family Groove Company, 56 Hope Road, Chicago Farmer, King Orange and Elwood, ticket information TBA

July 3: Cheap Trick with Omega Battalion, 8 p.m., $30

July 5: Diamond Rio, 8 p.m., $25

July 11: Too White Crew, 8 p.m., $10

July 19: Dark Star Orchestra, 8 p.m., ticket information TBA

July 26: Reggae on the Riverfront with Jah Roots and the Art of Ill Fusion, 8 p.m., $10

Aug. 8-9: River City Soul and Gospel Fest, time and ticket information TBA

Aug. 16: Budweiser Grand Nationals Rally feat. Blue Oyster Cult, time TBA, $10 before 6 p.m. and $15 after 6 p.m. at the gate

Aug. 29-30: Budweiser Illinois Blues Festival with Lonnie Baker Brooks and Wayne Brook (Aug. 29) and Jimmy Burns & the Tommy Castro Band (Aug. 30)

CLUB JAGER

4 Play Plaza, 500 Block Main St., Peoria, (309) 673-9893, www.myspace.com/4playplaza

July 15: Bret Michaels, time and ticket information TBA, after-party for that night’s Poison show

CRUSADERS FOR KIDS HAM N JAM

July 25-26, Exposition Gardens, 1601 W. Northmoor Road, Peoria, (309) 645-3209, www.crusadersforkids.org/Events.htm

July 26: Foghat with Armed & Hammered, Exit and Mister Sister, time and ticket information TBA

PEORIA CIVIC CENTER

201 S.W. Jefferson Ave., Peoria, (309) 673-8900, www.peoriaciviccenter.com. Tickets are available through Ticketmaster: by phone at 544-9400, (800) 827-8927 and (800) 359-2525 for TTY orders; online at www.ticketmaster.com; and at all physical outlets.

July 15: Poison with Sebastian Bach, 8 p.m., $48 and $23.50

Aug. 9: Lewis Black, time information TBA, tickets go on sale June 21

Nick Rogers can be reached at 747-9587. Read his blog at blogs.sj-r.com/unpaintedhuffhines.
